sn56.47:1.1.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso mahāsamudde ekacchiggaḷaṁ yugaṁ pakkhipeyya. Tatrāpissa kāṇo kacchapo. So vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṁ sakiṁ ummujjeyya.
sn56.47:1.1.en: “Mendicants, suppose a person was to throw a yoke with a single hole into the ocean. And there was a one-eyed turtle who popped up once every hundred years.

sn56.47:1.3.pli: api nu kho kāṇo kacchapo vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṁ sakiṁ ummujjanto amusmiṁ ekacchiggaḷe yuge gīvaṁ paveseyyā”ti?
sn56.47:1.3.en: Would that one-eyed turtle, popping up once every hundred years, still poke its neck through the hole in that yoke?”

sn56.47:2.1.pli: “Khippataraṁ kho so, bhikkhave, kāṇo kacchapo vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṁ sakiṁ ummujjanto amusmiṁ ekacchiggaḷe yuge gīvaṁ paveseyya, na tvevāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sakiṁ vinipātagatena bālena manussattaṁ vadāmi.
sn56.47:2.1.en: “That one-eyed turtle would poke its neck through the hole in that yoke sooner than a fool who has fallen to the underworld would be reborn as a human being, I say.

mn129:24.3.pli: Tatrāssa kāṇo kacchapo, so vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṁ ummujjeyya.
mn129:24.3.en: And there was a one-eyed turtle who popped up once every hundred years.

mn129:24.5.pli: api nu so kāṇo kacchapo amusmiṁ ekacchiggale yuge gīvaṁ paveseyyā”ti?
mn129:24.5.en: Would that one-eyed turtle still poke its neck through the hole in that yoke?”

mn129:24.8.pli: “Khippataraṁ kho so, bhikkhave, kāṇo kacchapo amusmiṁ ekacchiggale yuge gīvaṁ paveseyya, ato dullabhatarāhaṁ, bhikkhave, manussattaṁ vadāmi sakiṁ vinipātagatena bālena.
mn129:24.8.en: “That one-eyed turtle would poke its neck through the hole in that yoke sooner than a fool who has fallen to the underworld would be reborn as a human being, I say.

sn56.48:1.4.pli: Tatrassa kāṇo kacchapo. So vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṁ sakiṁ ummujjeyya.
sn56.48:1.4.en: And there was a one-eyed turtle who popped up once every hundred years.

sn56.48:1.6.pli: api nu kho kāṇo kacchapo vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṁ sakiṁ ummujjanto amusmiṁ ekacchiggaḷe yuge gīvaṁ paveseyyā”ti?
sn56.48:1.6.en: Would that one-eyed turtle, popping up once every hundred years, still poke its neck through the hole in that yoke?”

thig16.1:53.1.en: Remember the one-eyed turtle and the yoke with a hole
